reviewText:
This is a low end western with a substandard script and acting.

Sometime after a mother dies in childbirth, Dad, a gold miner decides he can't care for his children anymore and sends them all away, although he has a house keeper and an older daughter. The daughter works at a boarding house where she comes of age, with her love divided between a wealthy young man and a "half breed." But she is in no way torn by it.

Eventually the characters are all forced not to follow their dreams and it turns into a bad western soap opera. There were no skulls and the river only had a cameo. I am not sure where the interesting title came from.

There are better low budget westerns out there.

Parental Guide: No f-bombs, or nudity. Brief sex/ rape scenes. Prostitution.
Bruce Cole is the best actor!
Save money guys on this movie. Just not worth to be buy
Bringing it back to the classics!

This was about the most stupid production I've ever seen.  Beautiful scenery, costumes, etc.  Could have been an interesting plot but the way it was chopped up and put together and much of the high school quality acting finally got to me after about twenty minutes.  I tried to give it a fair chance several times but I couldn't stick with long enough to see if it got any better.  What a waste of money and spoiled my movie watching night then they added sales tax to my bill as well. Come on, Amazon Prime!  Do a little quality control.  For 99 bucks a year, you should pay me for sitting through the experience.

Absolutely the worst movie I have ever partially watched. Pointless, poorly acted, boring, meandering, and ended before it began. There is so much more to say, but any profanity would not be impulsive and is, therefore, improper. I'll beg Amazon for my money back.
We love Westerns with good story
This Western will keep you on the edge of your seat. It is full of action. If you like Westerns you will appreciate this
Great western need to be read

I went with five stars because this is a production with an awesome name, filmed in my neck of the woods, great costumes and scenery, good acting, and one of the actors is my mate.  Am I biased?  A bit...  Now to get one for our archives.  Thanks Lions Gate for believing in this film and Thanks Amazon for carrying it!  :)
It is because of movies like this that the Western genre is dying!

Lets start out i live in this cool lil town  where this movie was made so i  know some of the people in it,,,,They worked very hard all actors writter, costumes all details, and of course  all this beautiful scenery my husband and i loved it because some parts were right here by our home filmed so we appreciated all those details of  putting this western together....we love it here to begin with all the history of the gold rush back in the 1880s  its cool it was filmed here to begin with a very old minning town...so the history the feeling is already there.our home is over 150 years old so for all those who apprciate back in that era is special but to actually live here where it was filmed was priceless...so with that all said we give it a 5 plus....

OMG its a waste of time and money!  My question is why are we being charged for something that's not with watching even for free!  And by is the rating like it is?  Even if it was 50 cents I'd still ask for my money back it's that bad!
